background: A ski resort is looking to add two types of ski lifts, densely-seated and loosely-seated, to transport guests up the slopes. The lifts have different capacities, speeds, and electricity consumption rates. The resort aims to meet a minimum guest transportation rate while adhering to electricity usage constraints.
constraints: Number of densely-seated ski lifts is non-negative
Number of loosely-seated ski lifts is non-negative
Number of loosely-seated ski lifts is at least MinLooseLifts
Guests transported per minute by densely-seated and loosely-seated ski lifts combined is at least MinGuestsPerMin
Electricity used by all ski lifts combined does not exceed TotalElectricity
objective: Minimize the total number of ski lifts needed
description: An extremely large ski resort is looking into purchasing two types of ski lifts, a densely-seated one and a loosely-seated one. The densely-seated ski lift is able to bring \param{GuestsPerMinDense} guests up the slopes every minute whereas the loosely-seated ski lift can transport \param{GuestsPerMinLoose} guests every minute. The densely-seated ski lift uses \param{ElectricityDense} units of electricity and the loosely-seated lift uses \param{ElectricityLoose} units of electricity. There must be at least \param{MinLooseLifts} loosely-seated ski lifts because they move slower and are friendlier for beginners. The ski resort needs at least \param{MinGuestsPerMin} guests every minute to make a profit and has available \param{TotalElectricity} units of electricity. How many of each type of ski lifts should they plan to install to minimize the total number of ski lifts needed?

parameters.definition: Number of guests transported per minute by the densely-seated ski lift
Number of guests transported per minute by the loosely-seated ski lift
Electricity units used by the densely-seated ski lift
Electricity units used by the loosely-seated ski lift
Minimum number of loosely-seated ski lifts required
Minimum number of guests per minute required for profit
